summary: Student at Eindhoven University of Technology, exploring project management, app development, and diving deep into computer networks, systems, and cybersecurity. Passionate about innovation and collaboration in tech.

school.name: School of Mathematics and Natural Sciences Acad. Nikola Obreshkov

projects.title: Safe Exam Browser (SEB) Penetration Test
projects.description:
As part of Group 1 in 2IC80 Lab on offensive security at Eindhoven University of Technology, I contributed to an exploratory research project aiming to probe the security mechanisms of lockdown browsers, particularly Safe Exam Browser (SEB) and QuickSTEP. My primary role was focused on the Reverse Shell Method, an innovative approach that involved establishing a connection from the target machine (running QuickSTEP) to an attacker's machine. This attack vector provided remote access to the PowerShell instance on the target machine, allowing the execution of PowerShell commands without QuickSTEP's knowledge. I was instrumental in setting up this connection, providing critical insights into the potential exploitation of this vulnerability, and documenting the process.

Additionally, I had a secondary role in bypassing the virtual machine (VM) detector to enable SEB to run within a VM environment. This involved altering VM configuration and modifying certain SEB DLLs. Although the task was less complex compared to the Reverse Shell Method, it required an understanding of the interplay between VMs and the detection algorithms employed by SEB. My team and I successfully achieved this objective, thus demonstrating the potential for students to cheat during exams.

projects.title: TidyTeams: A Social App for Environmental Clean-ups
projects.description:
TidyTeams is a social app I had the pleasure of developing with a team as the SCRUM Master during my studies at Eindhoven University of Technology. The app serves as a platform for environmentally conscious individuals to easily discover, join, and organize clean-up events, making the clean-up process enjoyable and socially engaging.

Using Java and Android Studio, we designed this app specifically for Android 11.0 and later, ensuring compatibility with different screen sizes including Google Pixel 6 Pro and Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. The database was managed using Firebase.

I had a crucial role in project management, code development, and documentation. My key responsibilities included writing a majority of the code, establishing the app's flow, organizing logistics, and documenting requirements.

As the SCRUM Master, I facilitated communication and progress within our team, ensuring that every task and goal was achieved effectively. With our dedicated team efforts, we managed to fulfill all the mandatory requirements, delivering a quality app that simplifies participation in environmental clean-up activities and promotes social interaction.

Our accomplishment demonstrates our technical skills, teamwork, and commitment to creating an app that encourages a positive environmental impact. The experience was incredibly rewarding, offering us the opportunity to use our skills for a significant cause.

TidyTeams is a testament to our ability to develop an effective solution to a real-world problem. It represents our understanding of the users' needs and our capability to create an enjoyable user experience that serves a greater purpose.

profile_positions.description:
Managed the end-to-end development and marketing for the inaugural SkinniPeat trap party, a large scale event featuring eminent artists like MurdaBoyz and Dimoff. As the core contributor to this project, I designed and implemented a comprehensive, user-friendly website using Wix, integrated a ticket sales system, and drafted legal documents including terms and conditions.

The event took place at an abandoned factory on August 18th, offering attendees a unique ambiance that set it apart from traditional concerts. I also undertook various marketing and advertising initiatives, leveraging social media platforms such as TikTok and Instagram to boost our reach and generate ticket sales.

I successfully negotiated partnerships with alcohol sponsors and local restaurants, securing advertising spots in various high-traffic areas, resulting in increased visibility for our event. This collective effort resulted in a successful event that not only served as an incredible music experience but also worked to unify local communities and foster shared love for the genre.
profile_positions.title: Web Developer

company.name: Български Червен кръст / Bulgarian Red Cross

volunteer_experiences.description:
During my tenure as Secretary for Interact (Rotary), my responsibilities centered around the meticulous and efficient management of the club's core administrative duties.

I meticulously maintained membership records, ensuring all information was accurate, up-to-date, and kept confidential. This role required a keen attention to detail as I tracked attendance, accurately reflecting the participation and involvement of our esteemed members.

Additionally, I was responsible for recording comprehensive minutes of club, board, and committee meetings. This responsibility demanded a high level of attentiveness and excellent note-taking skills to accurately document all crucial discussions, decisions, and actions for future reference.

To foster continuity within the organization, I worked closely with the incoming secretary, preparing them for their new role. I shared essential knowledge, skills, and insights to ensure a seamless and effective transition of responsibilities.

In this role as secretary, I demonstrated strong organizational skills, effective communication, and a profound commitment to the smooth operation of our club.

In my role as Master of Ceremonies at Interact (Rotary), I took on the vital task of ensuring smooth and efficient meetings.

I was responsible for overseeing the flow of each meeting, seamlessly bridging between topics to maintain a coherent and engaging atmosphere. My ability to balance various elements of the agenda ensured the continuity and productive nature of our sessions.

Engagement was at the heart of my duties. I worked diligently to make all members feel included, fostering an environment where everyone's voice was heard. By engaging members with thought-provoking questions and tasks, I helped facilitate active participation and robust discussions.

One of my primary duties was managing the timing of the meeting. I kept a keen eye on the clock to ensure all topics were covered within the allotted time, maintaining the pace and effectiveness of the meeting.

Furthermore, I was tasked with keeping members informed. If any member missed a meeting or a crucial point, I ensured they were updated promptly, ensuring that everyone was on the same page and contributing to the overall effectiveness of our club.

In July 2018, I had the opportunity to serve as a tour guide for the Philippines team during the Bulgaria International Mathematics Competition 2018. In this role, I led group tours around local cities, showcasing popular landmarks and imparting historical knowledge about various sites. This unique experience combined my passion for mathematics and love for my local culture, allowing me to be an ambassador of sorts for the visiting team.
